alert.note: Alert for Morrow (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:50PM EST until February 19 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following county, Morrow. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 PM EST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. An automated gauge on Whetstone Creek in Mount Gilead shows the creek rising and will reach flood stage overnight. Flooding impacts will be immediately along this creek, especially near Cardington. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Gilead, Cardington and Edison. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
